item.title: Git: Changing Last Commit Using --amend.
item.author: pawangaria@gmail.com (Pawan Garia)
item.description: This tutorial will cover various methods of rewriting and altering Git history. Git uses a few different methods to record changes. If you ever find that you accidentally left something out of your last commit, be it a file or an extra change to a file that you just committed, don’t worry. It can easily be fixed using the git commit --amend. The git commit –amend command is a convenient way to modify the most recent commit.
